title: AI-powered police body cameras, once taboo, get tested on Canadian city's 'watch list' of faces
description: NEW YORK, Dec 7 : Police body cameras equipped with artificial intelligence have been trained to detect the faces of about 7,000 people on a “high risk” watch list in the Canadian city of Edmonton, a live test of whether facial recognition technology shunned as too intrusive could have a place in policing throughout North America. But six years after leading body camera maker Axon Enterprise, Inc. said police use of facial recognition technology posed serious ethical concerns, the pilot […]

title: AI/MI-based apps will play key role in power distribution: Manohar Lal
description: NEW DELHI, Dec 7 : Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)-based applications will play a pivotal role in building intelligent, consumer-centric, self-optimising distribution networks, Power Minister Manohar Lal said on Sunday. The minister was addressing participants at a two-day national conference focusing on the use of AI/ML technologies in the power distribution sector, here on Sunday, a power ministry statement said. He noted that the AI/ML-based solutions, smart meter analytics, digital twins, predictive maintenance, theft detection intelligence, appliance-level consumer […]
content:

title: OpenAI strikes deal on $4.6 bil AI center in Australia
description: ChatGPT maker OpenAI and an Australian data center operator have agreed to develop a multibillion-dollar AI center in Sydney. Brisbane-headquartered NextDC said it signed a memorandum of understanding with OpenAI to develop an artificial intelligence campus and a "supercluster" of graphics processing units. title: Jamie Dimon predicts AI will benefit mankind if properly regulated
description: Jamie Dimon told Fox News' Maria Bartiromo on Sunday that artificial intelligence will likely create more jobs "in the short run" given the technology is properly regulated.
content:
JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon offered an optimistic outlook on artificial intelligence (AI), predicting the technology will not "dramatically reduce" jobs over the next year — provided it is properly regulated.

title: AI’s next challenge: Take the CEO’s job
description: Why big-tech bosses say artificial intelligence is coming for them, too.
content:
